title: Don't trigger warnings when a prop is {null}
body:
**Do you want to request a _feature_ or report a _bug_?**
Bug

**What is the current behavior?**
When you have an unexpected prop in a component but that prop is not meant to be generated on the HTML DOM so that is set to {null}, React triggers this warning:

```
Warning: Unknown prop `activeClassName` on <h1> tag. Remove this prop from the element. For details, see https://fb.me/react-unknown-prop
    in h1 (created by HelloWorldComponent)
    in HelloWorldComponent
```

The actual use case is to have a reusable component called `<Anchor>` and it'd be either `<Link activeClassName="'is-active" />` or `<a activeClassName={null} />`. [Here's our actual code.](https://github.com/worona/worona-dashboard/blob/dev/client/packages/bulma-dashboard-theme-worona/src/components/Header/MenuItem.jsx#L25)
In the HTML output, there's no any activeClassName attribute for the second case, so there shouldn't be any react warning.

**Example reproducing it**
I've reproduced the issue in a simple example here:
https://jsbin.com/bozuwuq/edit?html,js,console,output

**What is the expected behavior?**
Don't warn when a prop is defined to {null} and, therefore, never generated in the DOM.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**
React version: 15.3.0
OS: Ubuntu and Mac OS X. Chromium and Google Chrome.
